Detailed Description

Provides a list of physically connected cameras available to be used/connected with neoAPI.

You can use this class if you don't know what camera(s) might be connected during program operation. With the neoapi::CamInfoList::Refresh() method you can update the list to reflect current system status We provide Plug and Play Events for the CamInfoList class which you can poll or register an callback for. Those will notify you of any changes on the system. If you get such an event, you still need to call neoapi. CamInfoList.Refresh() manually to update the list, see Event and Plug and Play Programming Concepts of the neoAPI for details

Note
This is a singleton and is only instanciated once

◆ GetPnPEvent()

virtual NeoEvent NeoAPI::CamInfoList::GetPnPEvent ( uint32_t  timeout = 400)
virtual

Get a plug and play event from the camera info list.

The GetPnPEvent method is used to retrieve plug and play events from the camera info list. Those events notify you that one ore more camera has been connected or disconnected from the system. If an event is waiting to be retrieved, it will return immediately, if no event is available at the time the method is called, it will wait for the timeout specified with the parameter timeout (in ms). The default Timeout is 400 ms

Parameters
[in]timeoutTimeout in ms to wait for an event, default is 400 ms
Returns
The NeoEvent object with all relevant data, could be empty
See also
NeoEvent::IsEmpty()
